name: murdering
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
murder
B1 to commit the crime of intentionally killing a person: Her husband was murdered by gunmen as she watched. In the last year, terrorists have murdered several local journalists.
informal If you say you will or could murder someone, you mean you are very angry with them: If he's late again, I'll murder him!
informal to do or perform something very badly, so that you spoil it completely: karaoke singers who murder pop classics
More examplesFewer examplesShe had murdered or connived at the murder of one of her lovers.She has been charged with conspiracy to murder.He'd do anything to cover his ass, including lie, cheat and murder.He murdered his victims with a crowbar.His daughter was murdered by a drug addict.
